concept.title: USB Mass Storage Server
concept.shortdesc: Used to read and write data on a USB host device.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: This document describes the USB client mass storage system, which is used to interact with media through USB when connected to a host (a PC or a Symbian platform device).

section.title: USB mass storage server features
section.p: The USB mass storage system provides the following features:

li.p: Provides services to access the media on the device (running Symbian platform) through a USB interface for the host.
To use it, the drive that on the Symbian device and that is going to be available to the PC must be using the FAT file system.
The device running Symbian platform must be connected to a host PC.
The media on the device running Symbian platform has to be using the FAT file system format.
